value: Shalom Shalom Shalom it is now the ninth
day of the 10th Eber month it is Friday
the January the 10th 2014 preparation
day Shabbat begins tonight and this
podcast is a teaching on who are the two
witnesses we know for a fact from
revelation 11 that the two witnesses
must be two men how do we know this
because there are three Greek words for
prophets one Greek word applies only to
male prophets one Greek word applies
only to female prophets and then there's
one Greek word that's used throughout
the renewed covenant the new Testament
that applies to both men and women
prophets but the Greek word used in
revelation 11 only refers to male
prophets so the two witnesses will be
men that's the first thing to realize
now what's very curious is that if you
do study on how all the 12 disciples the
12 apostles died you can find historical
sources from the foxes Book of Martyrs
and from other early historical accounts
written in the 1st and 2nd centuries
that shows how all of the 12 disciples
died except for one now we know Peter
was probably crucified upside down in
Rome we know that Thomas was martyred in
India we know that James it's recorded
right in the Bible that he was killed
murdered by Herod's men in Jerusalem all
the disciples we can account for except
for one and that's Apostle John the
author of the book of Revelation he was
boiled in oil and he survived and then
he was exiled to the island of Patmos
where he wrote the book of Revelation
and then he sort of vanishes from
history there's a scripture in
Revelation that says that John after he
writes this book of Revelation will yet
be called before kings and princes and
rulers to testify against him and yet
according to history after he wrote that
book he never did that he never appeared
on the world stage again it was a very
curious passage in John chapter 21 to go
right to the very end of John 21 Jesus
predicts to Peter how Peters gonna die
and then Peter turns to Yahshua and says
well what about John what's gonna happen
to him and Yahshua said well what's it
what's it to you if he survives or lives
until I return and then
even says in the following verses that
this rumor started spreading amongst the
early believers in the first century
that John the Apostle would not die
until Yahshua HaMashiach returns again
so I think it's very possible that John
the Apostle is one of the two witnesses
in fact I think it's more than possible
I think it's it's likely there's one
other person one another individual in
the Bible who suddenly vanishes without
a trace he just says he walks with yot
and then he's no more and yot takes him
away and that is Enoch Enoch has just
suddenly taken so it appears that Enoch
and Apostle John will be the two
witnesses
it cannot be Elijah Elijah was taken up
on a chariot into the sky and then
transported to another place on earth
and I prove that in in message three of
my messages to the hundred four four
thousand and then Elijah just later dies
a normal death can't be Moses Moses died
a normal death in fact we see Elijah and
Moses resurrected next to Yahshua on the
Mount of Olives
during the Transfiguration during Sukkot
in the Gospels so we know that they both
had died but Enoch and John they never
died and I think they're going to be the
two witnesses so we got Judas Iscariot
being the son of perdition
we got Enoch and John being the two
witnesses 2014 to 2017 is gonna be very
very interesting this is Daniel John Lee
with tor restoration ministries you can
click on the hyperlink in the About tab
right below this video and that will
allow you to go to an article I wrote
about this and you can also click on
another hyperlink right below this video
and you can click on my website spirit
or comm Shalom
